Georgia Scholarships


1906 Scholars Program
Scholarship for incoming freshmen who are enrolled full-time at Georgia Southern University. Students must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and a minimum 1300 SAT score. Award amount may vary. An interview is required. Renewable. more...

25Th Anniversary Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students attending Savannah College of Art & Design. Applicants must have academic and artistic ability, and have demonstrated financial need. Due date varies, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

4-H Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College. Students must be active 4-H members. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

A.D. Black Scholarship
Scholarship for residents Floyd County or Rome, Georgia who are undergraduate students attending Georgia Institute of Technology. Applicants and at least on parent must have been born in Floyd County or the city or Rome, and show need. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

A.H. (Jack) Robbins Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Butts, Spalding, Pike, Lamar or Upson County, Georgia who are entering freshmen at Georgia Institute of Technology. Applicants must have graduated from a school within Butts, Spalding, Pike, Lamar or Upson County. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Abac Ag Alumni Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate (seniors ineligible) students enrolled full-time at Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College Division of Agriculture and Forest Resources. Selection is based on academic achievement, leadership, character, personal and professional qualities. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Abac Foundation Ffa Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolling at Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College who held a state FFA officers position in Georgia. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and SAT score of 750. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Abac Staff Forum Scholarship
Employee-Related awards for dependents of ABAC staff who are incoming freshmen enrolling full-time at Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College. Applicants must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and SAT score of 750. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Abraham Baldwin Alumni Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and completed at least 20 credit hours. Preference given to children of alumni. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Abraham Baldwin Foundation Scholars Scholarship
Scholarship for graduates of Berrien High School, Colquitt County High School, Cook High School, Fitzgerald High School, Irwin County High School, Tift County High School, Tiftarea Academy, Turner County High School, and Worth County High School who will be enrolling full-time at Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College. Selection based on academic achievement. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Abraham Illges Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Georgia Institute of Technology enrolled in the School of Textile and Fiber Engineering. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Academic Decathlon Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at Columbus State University. Students must demonstrate academic achievement. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Academic Scholarship - Ung
The Academic Scholarships are available to entering freshmen at University of North Georgia. more...

Academic Scholarships & Grants
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolled full-time at Mercer University. Students must demonstrate academic achievement. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

Adam Allgood Automotive Leadership Award
Annual award for undergraduate students enrolled at Gwinnett Technical College pursuing studies in Automotive Technology program. Students must demonstrate leadership and be of the highest honor and integrity. Due date may vary. more...

Adolphus Bell Wright Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Clark Atlanta University majoring in Business/Economics. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and financial need. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Adrienne M. Herndon Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate (freshmen ineligible) students enrolled full-time at Clark Atlanta University. Students must have a minimum 2.8 GPA, financial need, and be involved in a performing arts activity (drama, band, choir, etc). Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Advertising Federation Of Fort Wayne Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Bowling Green State University majoring in Communication, Graphic Design, Marketing, Public Relations, or Telecommunications. Students must be U.S. citizens and reside in the area served by the Advertising Federation of Fort Wayne. Number of awards may vary. more...

Affinity Health Group Scholarship
Scholarship for college freshmen or sophomores enrolled full-time at Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College majoring in Pre-Medicine. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and a minimum 1000 SAT score. Preference given to Tift County residents, second preference given to residents of the contiguous counties. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Aflac Endowment For Servant Leadership
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Columbus State University. Students must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA, demonstrate leadership, and involvement in extracurricular activities. An interview is required. Number of awards and award amount may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Aft Roberts G. Porter Scholars Program
The AFT Robert G. Porter Scholars Program will provide four $8,000 scholarships for 4 years to those applicants who are children or legal dependents of members of the AFT. An additional 10 members of AFT will receive $1,000 grants to each to be used for continuing education or to strengthen their unions. Eligible students for the $8,000 must be graduating high school seniors. A legal guardian or one parent must be an active member of the AFT. The children and dependents of union staff do not qualify for these scholarships. Recipients will be required to maintain a 2.75 GPA to continue receiving the renewal of the scholarship. To be awarded the scholarship, students must demonstrate involvement in the community and school activities, leadership, special skills, and work experience. more...

Agco Corporation Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled at Gwinnett Technical College pursuing studies in Heavy Equipment Technology Program. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Agfa Monotype Foundation Scholarship
Bi-annual award for undergraduate junior student attending the Savannah College of Art and Design, majoring in Communication Arts. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrate noteworthy performance in one or more aspects of the typographic arts or interest in font or directly related technologies. Due date varies. Renewable; one year. more...

Agnes Davis Donaldson Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Abraham Baldwin Agricultural College. Students must have a minimum 3.3 GPA, attended ABAC at least two semesters and earned a minimum of 20 credit hours. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Agnes Delehanty Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for college sophomores enrolled full-time at Georgia Perimeter College majoring in Nursing. Students must have a minimum 2.7 GPA. Number of awards may vary. A copy of most recent tax return must be included with application packet. more...

Selection is based on academic achievement, community service, leadership skills, and participation in extracurricular activities. Due date and number of awards may vary. A resume must be included with application packet. more...

Applicants must qualify as Presidents Scholars with superb leadership, academic performance and promise, and be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Preference is given to out-of-state students with demonstrated financial need. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Selection is based on a combination of GPA, SAT, and the quality and nature of high school activities. more...

This scholarship was renamed in memory of a former club president: The Andrea Kay Lane Scholarship. more...

Applegate-Jackson-Parks Future Teacher Scholarship
Applegate-Jackson-Parks Future Teacher Scholarship dedicates $1,000 to one student who exemplifies the superior principles and high professional standards similar to those for whom the scholarship was founded. Applicants can be undergraduate or graduate students of US higher learning institutions. Employees, officers, directors, and family members of the National Right to Work Committee, Members of the Selection Review Committee, and the National Institute for Labor Relations Research are not eligible to apply. You will be required to complete an essay, a transcript, and a formal application. Applicants will also be required to prove their understanding that you do not have to join a union and the dangers of teacher unions to the education system. more...

Arch Rowan Scholarship

Preference given to students planning to study animal science or a related field. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Atlanta Air Cargo Association Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the Atlanta Air Cargo Association. Applicants must be admitted to the College of Business. Preference will be given to applicants who have completed or who are enrolled in at least one of the Logistics and Supply Chain Management courses and who are working towards the supply chain minor or major with a minimum 2.8 GPA. Consideration will be given to student focusing on studies in the international trade, logistics and/or transportation business field. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, have completed a minimum 15 hours at Georgia State University, completed an internship, demonstrate financial need, leadership, and interest in a career in the life and health insurance industry. Atlanta Music Project Annual Scholarship
The Atlanta Music Project Provides intense music education for under served youth. This scholarship will be awarded to full time students in good standing at CSU; majoring or having a minor or concentration, in music and who are current interns of AMP. A committee comprised of Music faculty will identify the students and notify the Office of Financial Aid no later than April 1 for awards for the following Fall. Students receiving the scholarship may apply for additional monies each year for up to three additional years. more...

Atlanta Youth Academy (Aya) Spanish Enrichment Annual Scholarship
The AYA Spanish Enrichment Annual Scholarship was established by the Atlanta Youth Academic (AYA). The scholarship is for a student who is either minoring in Spanish, or is a native Spanish speaker. Preference will be given to fulltime students in good standing who are enrolled in the SPAN 4800 – Spanish Internship course. Students may apply for this scholarship via either the Chair of the Humanities Department or Chair of the Teacher Education Department in March for the following year. Receiving the scholarship for the Spring Semester is contingent on successful completion of SPAN 4800 – Spanish Internship Course and a continuation of the course for the Spring Semester. more...

Baker Family Annual Scholarship
The Baker Family Annual Scholarship is established by Gordon N. Baker in honor of his parents, Mary N. and Howard F. Baker. Dr. Baker established this scholarship in recognition of the more than 100 years of service the Baker family has contributed to public schools of Clayton and Henry counties. Dr. Howard Baker served as teacher, principal, and Superintendent of Schools. Mrs. Mary N. Baker served as a classroom teacher and was Henry County School 1976 Teacher of the Year. Dr. Gordon N. Baker served as classroom teacher, library/media specialist in both school systems, coordinator of instructional technology and library media services in Henry County, and librarian and Dean of Libraries at Clayton State University. This scholarship is created to provide for students majoring in Education who have a GPA of 3.0 or higher, are in good standing, and demonstrate financial need. Preference will be given to students who are from Henry, Clinch, or Lowndes counties in Georgia or Columbia county, Florida. more...

The Baker Family Endowed Scholarship is established by Gordon N. Baker in honor of his parents, Mary N. and Howard F. Baker. Dr. Baker established this scholarship in recognition of the more than 100 years of service the Baker family has contributed to public schools of Clayton and Henry counties. Dr. Howard Baker served as teacher, principal, and Superintendent of Schools. Mrs. Mary N. Baker served as a classroom teacher and was Henry County School 1976 Teacher of the Year. Dr. Gordon N. Baker served as classroom teacher, library/media specialist in both school systems, coordinator of instructional technology and library media services in Henry County, and librarian and Dean of Libraries at Clayton State University. This scholarship is created to provide for students majoring in Education who have a GPA of 3.0 or higher, are in good standing, and demonstrate financial need. Preference will be given to students who are from Henry, Clinch, or Lowndes counties in Georgia or Columbia county, Florida. more...

Best Cheap Reviews $2,000 Scholarship 2017
Eligibility
•Full-time student chasing a diploma in Enterprise, Management, Marketing, Economics or related fields.
•A student can apply only once.
Scholarship Requirements
•Fill the forms at the end of the page.
•Brief essay.
•Provide verification that proves you’re currently chasing a qualification in Enterprise, Management, Marketing, Economics or any similar field.
Entry Requirements
Submit a quick essay that won’t go beyond 1000 words telling us all what your reasons running after the career in business or a related field are. Please don’t write it to formal as we’re looking for creative individuals and we’re anticipating to hear your encounters and reasons for choosing the path in business.
Judged On
•Creativity.
•Vision for the future.
•Field where you chasing a degree.
Award
Total award: _$2, 000 _(one-time scholarship grant for only one student)
Form of award: Mailed in the form of check to your address.
Winner Announcement: Personal email and scholarship page on our webpage.
Deadline: December 29th, 2017 more...

To apply, you must write a blog post on mental health, whether that’s about your personal experiences, tips for coping, or general awareness for mental illness in college.
Write a 800- to 1,500-word, double-spaced article on the topic above and submit your mental health scholarships to Support@bigmoods.com. Please include the following:

Bright Futures Scholarship For Early Childhood Teachers
Bright Futures Scholarship for Early Childhood Teachers provides several scholarships ranging from $250 to $1,000 for prospective ECE teachers. The organization is dedicated to providing a better start to all children and they believe that starts with the teachers of young children. You have to be enrolled full-time into an accredited program to apply. Eligible applicants must have experience working with children younger than the age of six for at least nine months, proven excellence in major coursework, and a minimum GPA of 3.0. Qualified applicants must also have at least 15 completed credits in an associate degree program, 30 completed credits in a bachelor’s degree program, or acceptance into a master’s degree program when the application is submitted. more...

To support Georgia students pursuing a two-year or four-year Registered Nursing degree at an accredited nursing school in Georgia.
Eligibility Criteria
•Resident of Georgia

•Commitment to community service.

Cims (College Of Information And Mathematical Sciences) Dean's Annual Dm Scholarship
This scholarship has been established by Dr. Roberts, the Dean of the College of Information & Mathematical Sciences (CIMS). This annual scholarship will be awarded to full-time students majoring in mathematics, Computer Science or Information Technology. Students eligible are incoming freshmen with a score of 1100 or above in the combined/math/critical reading of the SAT or an ACT composite score of 24 and a 3.5 GPA OR a sophomore, junior, or senior at Clayton State who is enrolled in the outlined majors and holds a minimum 3.2 institutional GPA. This scholarship is not available for students enrolled in Learning Support courses. more...

Clayton State Veterans Annual Scholarship
The Clayton State Veterans Annual Scholarship is being established by Bruce and Vicky Gant. As a combat medic in the Vietnam War, Bruce is a decorated combat veteran, a member of the Military Order of the Purple Heart, and a Captain in the Old Guard of the Gate City Guard. Recognizing the supreme sacrifice that our veterans make for our country, this scholarship is a way to give back to those who wish to complete their degree. This scholarship is created to provide scholarships for students in good standing who are veterans and demonstrate financial need. more...

Clayton State Veterans Endowed Scholarship
The Clayton State Veterans Annual Scholarship is being established by Bruce and Vicky Gant. As a combat medic in the Vietnam War, Bruce is a decorated combat veteran, a member of the Military Order of the Purple Heart, and a Captain in the Old Guard of the Gate City Guard. Recognizing the supreme sacrifice that our veterans make for our country, this scholarship is a way to give back to those who wish to complete their degree. This scholarship is created to provide scholarships for students in good standing who are veterans and demonstrate financial need. more...

College Park Scholarship
Mayor Jack P. Longino created the College Park Mayoral Second Hand Scholarship for high school students in College Park that did not achieve beyond a 3.0 GPA. College Park provides supplemental financial assistance for families that otherwise would not have the means to offer to the prospective student.
Eligibility: Applicants must meet all of the following conditions:
1.U.S. Citizen or proof of eligibility for non-citizen.
2.Residency of College Park, Georgia.
3.High School Graduate of current school year.
4.Acceptance with the intent of attending an accredited college, university or technical program for the Fall term of the academic year.
5.Minimum GPA 2.75-3.0 on a 4.0 GPA scale as of the end of the graduating semester. more...

Colleges Sports Recruiting Scholarship
As an organization we are proud to award a $1,000 scholarship to a college student who best represents a true leader in sports and life. We encourage all current or future college students who competed in a sport at the high school level to apply for the College Sports Recruiting Scholarship. The winner will be selected by the CSS Recruiting Scholarship Committee.
Who is Eligible
•Any current or former student athlete. You do not need to be a college athlete to apply.
•Current or future college students *High School seniors who will be attending college are eligible.
What to Write
Write about a time you were the leader in an important moment on the field or in your community. Describe what you did and what you learned from that experience. The essay needs to be written in 1,000 words or less.
More Details
•The scholarship can only be applied towards the cost of tuition, books or room and board. The scholarship winner will have a check written in their name to their university where the funds will be applied directly to costs of school
•Any current or former athletes who have worked with CSS Recruiting are not eligible to win the award. We do not want to create any conflicts of interest. more...

Don And Louise Hettermann Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was created by gifts from Kay Chester, Gary and Cassandra Hettermann and Janie Hettermann in honor of Don and Louise Hettermann. Applicants must be enrolled in, or admitted to, Clayton State and have a minimum 2.5 GPA; must demonstrate financial need which is determined after completion of the FAFSA. Entering freshmen are encouraged to apply. Funds are designated to student enrolled in the College of Health with preference given to students in the School of Nursing. However, students in the hands-on health profession, such a dental hygienists and allied health technicians are eligible to apply. Recipients may apply for scholarship in subsequent years but must have a minimum 3.0 GPA if reapplying. more...

Dorothy Adams Annual Honors Scholarship
The Dorothy Adams Annual Honors Scholarship of the Community Foundation of Greater Atlanta was established on July 19, 2013 by Ben Loggins, Fund Advisor, with a gift of $10,000.
A $2,500 scholarship will be awarded four times, to four different students over the next four years, to a full time Clayton State University freshman student who is involved in the Honors Program, who have completed one semester at Clayton State, and who have – and remain eligible to receive – the HOPE Scholarship from the state of Georgia. The student also must have submitted a written “Educational Plan,” to the board of directors of Ladies of Favor, Inc. Empowerment Program of Jonesboro, GA. more...

This memorial scholarship for Dorothy Adams was established by Ben Loggins and the Community Foundation for Greater Atlanta, Inc. Applicants must be enrolled at Clayton State in the Department of Psychology and Human Services, must be continuing student with minimum 2.8 institutional GPA, and must demonstrate financial need which is determined by completion of the FAFSA. Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled at Georgia Perimeter College majoring in Nursing. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, demonstrate community service, and be willing to work at Emory Eastside Medical Center (EEMC) for one year immediately after graduation. Applicants will have the opportunity to participate in EEMCs Nurse Graduate Program. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Emory Hospital Scholar Program
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled at Georgia Perimeter College majoring in Nursing. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, be in the first or second year of the Nursing Program, score at the national average on the NET Test, and be willing to work at one of the Emory Hospitals (Emory Hospital, Crawford Long Hospital, Wesley Woods Geriatric Hospital) for two years immediately after graduation. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Emory Scholars Program
Scholarship for incoming freshmen planning to attend Emory University in Georgia full-time. Candidates must be a U.S. citizen. Applicants must be nominated by their high school counselor (see Emory College catalog for detailed information). Recipients of these academic awards are selected by a committee comprised of Emory faculty and staff. Selection is based on merit, not financial need. Award amount varies. more...

Future Nurse Scholarship Program
Eligibility Requirements:
In order to participate in the scholarship contest, applicants must meet the following criteria:
• Be full-time students enrolled in a regionally or nationally-accredited institution.
• Actively pursuing a degree in nursing or a sub specialty of nursing with at least 30 completed credit hours.
• Submit a copy of most recent official transcripts.
• Submit a 1-page essay describing motivations and goals.
• Submit a recent and updated resume.
• Possess a GPA of 3.3 or higher. more...

Gates Millennium Scholars Programs
The goal of the Gates Millennium Scholars Program is to provide support to all American citizens. The program is designed to create an equal playing field to those typically underserved in higher learning institutions, such as outstanding students who are African Americans, American Indians, Alaska Natives, Islander Americans, and Hispanic Americans. One thousand students will be awarded each year by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. Applicants in pursuit of an undergraduate degree can pursue these scholarships. If you are pursuing a few specific areas, including education, you can also apply for funding for a graduate degree. more...

Headphones Scholarship
Listofbeststuff.com, as the name suggests, is a List of Top Rated Gadgets and Products in various categories, (such as headphones and speakers). In a nutshell, we help consumers select the product which can cover most of their requirements.
How to Participate?
You have to write an article on the topic:* The future of audio technology.*
Your article should be at least 500 words.
Note: Plagiarized content will be rejected.
Eligibility Requirements
You are eligible to enter into this scholarship program if you study at a state college, university, or a community college and as long as you’re attending high education classes. There is no minimum GPA requirement or age restriction to enter this competition.
How to submit your work?
Email your article at: scholarship@listofbeststuff.com
You should include your:
1.Name
2.Email
3.Name of Institute
4.Area of Expertise
Important Dates
Deadline: 27th of Every Month.
We will announce the winner by 30th. Your $1000 scholarship will be sent via Paypal or a Check. more...

Hearts For Community Service Scholarship Award
In honor of Warrick Dunn’s philanthropic spirit, Warrick Dunn Charities’ Hearts for Community Service Scholarship invites post-secondary education students, who are hands on in bettering their communities to apply. Students of Florida, Georgia and Louisiana have the chance to receive a $1,000 scholarship award towards the 2017 – 2018 academic school year.
Eligibility:
Must provide volunteer service to their local community
Must be attending post‐secondary education
Must be a resident or attending school in Florida, Georgia or Louisiana
A minimum GPA of 2.0 on a 4.0 grading scale
Deadline:
The Hearts for Community Service Scholarship application and required documents should be submitted no later than July 31, 2017 by 5 p.m. EST. All documents should be submitted together, via mail postmarked no later than July 31, 2017. Any submissions received after the deadline and/or incomplete will not be considered.
Please click the link to view the list of required documents. more...

Icomparefx Usa Scholarship 2017
iCompareFX is offering a scholarship of US $1000 towards a student’s living and tuition fees.
Scholarship
iCompareFX will provide US $1000 towards tuition and living fees for a student in their chosen field of study within Marketing, Business, Digital Design, IT or any internet business related field.
Eligibility Criteria
The applicant must meet the following eligibility criteria to be considered for the scholarship:
•An American resident 18 years or over
•The applicant must be a full-time student and able to prove they are studying at a College or University in America
•The Student must be studying in one of the following disciplines: Marketing, Business, IT, Digital Design or any e-business related field
How to Apply
All applicants should email the following to scholarship.usa@icomparefx.com:
•Current Resume/CV
•Enrollment confirmation letter of the Course and University / College where the applicant studies
•A letter outlining why this scholarship can help your future career (maximum of 400 words)
Value: US $1000
 Open Date: April 1, 2017
 Closing Date/ Deadline for entries: November 20, 2017
 Award Selection: All submissions that meet the eligibility requirements will be reviewed by a judging panel. The winning submission will be notified in writing on or before November 30, 2017 via email and posted on the iCompareFX website. more...

Inspire Our Future Scholarship
The Inspire Our Future Scholarship is provided by Teacher.org. This organization advocates for prospective teachers and other education positions. Some of the majors of people who qualify for the $500 scholarship include early childhood education, child development, special education, and a general degree in education. You can be in pursuit of a bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, or a doctoral degree. Applicants must be at least 18, a legal US resident, and hold a minimum 3.5 GPA. US territories and Puerto Rico residents do not qualify. The same is true of any person, family member, or persons with the same residence of any Teacher.org employee or those with any affiliation to the organization. more...

Jewish Community Centers Of North America Graduate Education Scholarship Program
Five students who are enrolled in a graduate degree program full-time will be eligible for the Jewish Community Centers of North America Graduate Education Scholarship Program. Each student will qualify for the semester-based $5,000 scholarship. This award will either be dedicated for one to four semesters to each recipient. For those applying and pursuing a degree in education, you must be pursuing a master’s degree in either health, physical education, or early childhood education. If you are awarded a scholarship, you will be expected to participate in and complete a field placement position at a Jewish Community Center. more...

The John Word West Foundation offers scholarships to new undergraduate students who will begin attending Fall Semester. Transfer students must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative transfer GPA. more...

Kaiser Endowed Scholarships
The guidelines for the Kaiser Endowed Scholarships are as follows:
1. Student must have a GPA of 3.0 or greater.
2. Student must be a second degree student or have 120 or more credit hours earned
3. Student must be accepted for the BSN program and be attending 10 or more hours each semester.
4. Student must be a Student Nurses Association member
5. Financial need is not a consideration in the award. more...

Students must have exhausted all financial aid opportunities and are currently enrolled or have completed a minimum of one semester in the Nursing Program. Due date and number of awards may vary. A copy of the FAFSA/SAR must be included with application packet. more...

Karen Weaver Memorial Scholarship
The Karen Weaver Memorial Annual Scholarship is being established in her memory by her husband, Ross and her daughters, Lisa and Nikki. Dr. Karen Weaver was a dedicated nursing faculty member in the school of nursing at Clayton State from 2001-2013. Up to three scholarships will be awarded to RN to BSN nontraditional students who demonstrate financial need and are in good standing. Preference will be given to a student who is a single parent. more...

Lasting Legacy Scholarships
The annual Lasting Legacy Scholarship Awards are provided by the National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC). Applicants must be student members in the need of professional and skill development as an early childhood education professional. You will have to complete an application online and provide a letter of recommendation, a resume, and essays. You will have to demonstrate your accomplishments directly related to your work with children who are younger than eight. As a recipient, you will also be compensated for expenses related to the National Institute for Early Childhood Professional Development the year in which you receive the award. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student who is a junior attending Oglethorpe University in Atlanta, Georgia to major in Pre-Med. Recipient is selected from the three pre-medical students who have the highest cumulative GPA through their junior year and plan to attend an American medical school. Clayton County Commissioner Michael Edmondson, who represents District Four, has established a scholarship fund to financially assist students who are enrolled at Clayton State University. Applicants must be enrolled in, or admitted to, Clayton State University. Continuing students must demonstrate solid academic excellence as defined by a minimum 2.8 institutional GPA. Applicants must have attended, or be attending, a Clayton County high school. more...

Moving Authority 2017 Scholarship
The essay topic:
Discuss a moving experience you had and how you would have improved it. What are some creative ideas you have for people who are currently in the process of moving? You must use a specific keyword about the industry, which can be given to you by emailing us at support@movingauthority.com.
The winner will be determined by the following:
- Overall quality of the writing
- The thought the writer put into the response
- Out of the box thinking used (a little industry humor, we know)
- The essay must be at least 1,000 words in length (and no more than 1,300) more...

Students who are members of a member church of the National Association of Congregational Christian Churches or United Church of Christ are eligible to receive an award equivalent to one third of tuition. Recipients are required to live in campus housing. more...

Nordson Builds
Scholarships ranging from $2,000 to $10,000 will be awarded to students planning to enroll or already enrolled in an accredited public or private not-for-profit postsecondary institution.
Selection will be based on an overall assessment of academic promise, leadership skills, character, community service, motivation, school involvement, and the applicant’s career/college major fit. You must complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) in order to be considered for the Nordson BUILDS Scholarship Program. more...

Scholarship recipients will be chosen by a selection committee based on an overall assessment of academic promise, character, leadership, work ethic, community service, school involvement, and the applicant’s career/college major fit. more...

Students applying to African American grants for education must be African American. Federal education grants are typically awarded based on the applicant’s financial needs, as determined initially by the FAFSA. State and privately funded African American grants may have separate or additional requirements based on the applicant’s place of residence, level of academic achievement, or planned course of study. more...

Public Service Scholarship
The public sector is the part of the economy that encompases public services and enterprises. Generally speaking, these services are provided by the government and are publically funded. Such services include telecommunications, electrical grids, police, military, public education, some aspects of healthcare, and infrastructure such as bridges, roads, water supply, tunnels, sewers, and public transit. These services are usually provided to payers and non-payers alike, and stand to benefit society as a whole, and are typically self-financed or non-profits. more...

Robert Noyce Teacher Scholarship Program
The Robert Noyce Teacher Scholarship Program offers financial assistance to up to 70 recipients, and many scholarships are recurring. These scholarships are dedicated to teachers who wish to teach science, math, technology or engineering to students between the grades of kindergarten and year twelve. The program is designed to assist teachers in school districts that have a high demand for STEM teachers. Program recipients are required to work with various associations to help determine the best strategies and practices for selecting, attracting, and preparing new elementary and secondary teachers to be able to be effective as STEM teachers. more...

Scad Scholars Scholarship

Scholarship Essay Contest By Essaypro
Our main goal is to make students’ lives better across the globe. This goes far beyond simply helping with academic assignments. There are an incredible amount of talented young men and women out there and we want to hear from them!
Periodical Essay Writing Contest
We would like to invite all of our soon-to-be Shakespeares to take part in our quarterly contest! If you feel like your work is worth more than just good grades, then hop on in!
Our team of editors will choose the three best pieces of Word Art, with the authors receiving:
Sweet Money Prizes:
1st place will receive $500, with 2nd and 3rd place winning $250 each!
Recognition from some of the best academic writers in the USA!
We’ll put their essays on our website and share through every social media channel we have (If author’s permission is granted).
Deadline:
All works should be submitted by 11:59 PM, September 20th, 2017. Our skilled judges will review the works and the winners’ names (or nicknames) will be revealed on the 25th of September.
Essays submitted after the deadline will not take part in the contest.
Guidelines:
•Basic scholarship essay format. Works should be 600-800 words. Some minor deviations are possible, but not desirable.
•Plagiarism is not allowed. WE WILL CHECK if there is any.
•Essays should only be written in English. We are aware that you may know a lot of beautiful languages and totally support that, but rules are rules.
•Send your work in a Microsoft Word document.
•You can include images in your work, especially if they illustrate the topic or your own ideas. This will only grow our attention!
•Include your contact information in the document (Email is preferred). Otherwise, we might not be able to contact you and give instructions on prize collection.
Topics
For the first of our essay contest, we have chosen topics that college and university face most often. Choose one of the following:
•Is Technology Our Friend?
•What really is the American Dream?
•This is What I Believe In:
•An essay on the principle of population
•Abortion: Choice or Murder?
•What is Respect?
•Do Humans Understand Each Other?
•Nature vs Nurture
•Should a Person Give Up on Career for the Sake of Family?
•Life Goals vs Family Values
•The Double Edged Sword that is Gun Control. more...

Single Mother Scholarship
2017 Eligibility Requirements:
This scholarship is available to all single mothers who meet the following criteria:
Are a single parent
Custodial care of one or more children under 18
Do not have a college degree from a 4-year institution
Are enrolled in a 4-year institution or have a high school diploma
How to Apply:
Please submit a 1,200 to 1,500 word essay in PDF or Word Doc format to the attached submission form along with your full name, address and contact details. We also require an unofficial copy of your high school transcript or college transcript.
The essay topic is as follows:
We want to hear your story. Therefore, we request you write a personal narrative describing yourself, your family and what education means to you. Why do you want to obtain a college degree? And how will this scholarship help you achieve your goals? more...

Smartmail Scholarship Fund
SmartMail proudly supports young students in reaching their full potential to become the leaders of tomorrow in the fasted growing industries. For so many Americans, a higher education can pave the way to a better future for them, their families, and their communities.
ELIGIBILITY
To qualify for a SmartMail scholarship:
•You must be aged between 18-25 years of age
•You must be a citizien of the United States
•You must have a High School Diploma or equivalent
•You must currently be an undergraduate or postgraduate student.
Successful applicants will be selected based on their written application, academic potential, ability to meet the criteria and performance in an interview, where appropriate, before a selection panel including SmartMail. SmartMail reserves the right to void the scholarship at any time upon its own discretion.
If you are interested, click the link to view criteria and essay topic. more...

Steve Dearduff Scholarship Fund
For undergraduate and graduate students pursuing degrees in medicine and/or social work.
Eligibility Criteria
•Legal resident of Georgia
•Enrollment in or acceptance to an accredited institution of higher learning and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in medicine or social work
•Demonstrated history of commitment to community service
•Potential for success in chosen field
•Minimum 2.0 GPA
•Demonstrates financial need
•Previous applicants are encouraged to reapply but must obtain and submit the current year’s application form.
•Previous recipients are not guaranteed additional awards.
Award Amount
Up to $2,500 annually
Scholarships Available
Up to three annually
Deadline
February 14, 2020 more...

Sump Pump Guides Scholarship 2017-2018
This Sump pump guides scholarship 2017-2018 available for the students of undergraduate and postgraduate students. It is the opportunity for the students to win $500 by writing the 1000-1500 words on the given topic. Only those candidates will win this scholarship that can unique, informative and impressive content and can connect people through their words.
Following are the topics to write. So pick one and start writing:
How can automation technology improve the housing efficiency?
Is sump pump is the essential for home improvement?
What aspect should people consider before purchasing the sump pump?
Write a brief note on the sump pump failures and how to fix them
Buying online submersible is safe or not?
Application requirements and eligibility
Candidate needs to submit their information on the sumpumpguides.net along with their name, email, ID proof to prove their student identity. They must be able of think creatively and can connect with the readers. Every candidate needs to be a student of the undergraduate or postgraduate student, and he/she needs to write unique 1000-1500 words on the provided topic. Keep in mind your content must be unique and informative. Candidate must have the ability to influence people towards your subject. more...

Tech High School Alumni Assoc./W.O. Cheney Merit Scholarship Fund
For students pursuing degrees in mathematics, engineering or one of the physical sciences.
Eligibility Criteria
•A legal US citizen
•A legal resident of the state of Georgia for at least three years prior to application
•Demonstrate high moral qualities
•Have earned a cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher, or be in the upper 15% of his/her graduating class
•Combined SAT score of at least 1300 (math and reading) OR ACT composite of at least 29
•Have been accepted to a four-year accredited college or university to pursue an undergraduate degree in mathematics, engineering or one of the physical sciences
•Enrolling as a full-time student
•Demonstrate a commitment to community service
•Preference will be given to: •A student attending a college or university in the state of Georgia
•A student who, in his/her essay, claims and can verify a connection with Tech High School
Award Amount
$5,000 annually for up to four years
Scholarships Available
Up to four new awards annually
Deadline
February 14, 2020 more...

These women must be returning or beginning their college education at Clayton State University. This scholarship was renamed in memory of a former club president: The Andrea Kay Lane Scholarship.

The Cigarhumidorguy.Com Scholarship
The Cigarhumidorguy.com Scholarship
Do You Qualify?
We are looking for students from universities and colleges to make their mark here. High school students or students below the age of 18, you need to get consent from your parents or legal guardians.
A strong passion for health and learning new things. If you think you can show your talent and a well-formed essay and add more quality then the next person then we want to hear from you.
What We Need
Write an essay between 1000-1500 words about:
How Can We Educate Young People On The Dangers of Smoking?
It should have a clear thesis and be free of grammatical errors. If you have a personal experience feel free to include it in the essay.
How You Benefit
•The winner receives $1,000
•The money will be sent directly to your financial aid office.
•The best essay wins and the winner will be notified by e-mail.
How To Send Your Essay
You can send your essay along with these details:
1.First and last name
2.Name of school/college/university
3.Area of study
4.Proof that you are a student
5.Your unique email address assigned by your institution if possible.
You can use the submission form or you can send it to us directly: scholarships@cigarhumidorguy.com
The final date we will be accepting submissions is December 12th each year. A winner will be chosen by December 20th and will be notified. The scholarship will be sent over before December 25th. more...

The Dr. David Satcher Annual Retention Scholarship
The Dr. David Satcher Annual Retention Scholarship will be split evenly each year. One half will be designated for students who are in good standing, demonstrate need and have been identified by the Office of Financial Aid as being at significant risk of not being able to continue their education at Clayton State University due to financial challenges.
The second half will be designated for students who are enrolled in the College of Health, are in good standing, and demonstrate need. more...

The Fusion Electronix Scholarship
Our main goal at Fusion Electronix is to make the lives of our customers better. To make financing education simpler, we are offering a scholarship to one student every year who is also passionate about gadgets.
Scholarship Amount
$1000
Eligibility
You are either:
a high school senior that has been accepted to an accredited university or
a current undergraduate student enrolled in an accredited university.
Application Requirements
Please write a 800-1500 word essay about gadgets that you use for your education. How do you use technology to make your education simpler? How do you think that technology can be improved to help students?
In addition to your essay, please record a 5-10 minute video demonstrating how you use technology for your education.
Submit proof of enrollment or an acceptance letter in an accredited university that is listed on the official website of the U.S. Department of Education. Applicants attending military academies are ineligible for this scholarship. All school transfers are subject to accreditation approval.
Please be advised in the privacy policy below that your submission can be shared publicly. more...

The Investmentzen $1K Financial Future Scholarship
InvestmentZen aims to promote a lifetime of financial responsibility which starts as soon as we start managing our own money.
How to Apply / Guidelines
To enter, please submit an essay (500-1500 words) in English answering one of the following:
1.How are you managing your money in college to prepare for a bright financial future?
2.What financial challenges have you overcome in your life? What lesson(s) did they teach you?
3.What are the most common financial pitfalls you see your peers making, and what advice do you have for them?
Opens: April 10, 2017
Deadline: April 1, 2018 at 11:59pm GMT
Winner notified: April 15, 2018 more...

The James M. & Virginia M. Smyth Scholarship Fund
To provide financial support to students enrolled at an accredited college pursuing an undergraduate degree.
Eligibility Criteria
•Cumulative 3.0 GPA
•Accepted for enrollment or enrolled at an accredited college, university or technical school
•Demonstrated financial need
•Pursuing an undergraduate degree in the arts and sciences, human services, music or ministry
•Commitment to community service through school, community or religious organizations
•Preference will be given to applicants from Georgia, Illinois, Missouri, Mississippi, Oklahoma, Tennessee and Texas
•Adults returning to school in order to increase employability are eligible
•Previous recipients are renewed if they continue to meet the scholarship’s criteria and submit the current year’s renewal application
Award Amount
$2,000 annually for up to four years
Scholarships Available
12–15 awards annually
Deadline
February 14, 2020 more...

The Publicity.Ai Seo & Content Marketing Scholarship
A $1,000 Scholarship For Emerging Marketing Geniuses
The Publicity.ai SEO & Content Marketing Scholarship is a highly competitive award for high school and college students interested in SEO and content marketing.
Students applying must submit a brief essay explaining the best use of content marketing -the act of producing content to compel your audience to appreciate and share it- that they have seen. In 5 paragraphs or less, you should share what you saw (feel free to link to it if its online), how it made you feel, the call-to-action, and ultimately explain why a certain marketing campaign was the best use of content marketing that you have ever seen for the purposes of achieving business goals (typically increasing revenue and profits).
Studying in the fields of Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Communications, or IT are recommended but not required. more...

Usattorneys.Com Immigration Scholarship Essay Contest
Eligible: Any US resident or citizen that has been accepted to, or is currently attending, an accredited American university or college (checks will be made payable to the college).
To enter, the student must submit a 800 to 1000 word legal essay on ANY of the following topics:
Deportation
How to Apply for a Work Visa H1B
The Importance of Having an Immigration Lawyer
Investment Visas
Explain the different types of visas
Please include the city and state where you live in the essay.
For submission, simply email your essay as an attachment, in PDF or Word format. Please include your full name, school you will be or are attending, and contact information to immigrationscholarship@damg.com more...

How to Apply:
Any student who fits the eligibility requirements can apply for the USAttorneys.com divorce law scholarship. To enter student must submit an 800 to 1000 word legal essay on any of the following topics:
Divorce Law (in your state)
Child Custody (in your state)
Divorce Mediation (in your state) more...

Women’s Chamber Of Commerce Scholarship Fund
For students enrolled in undergraduate studies at an accredited four-year college.
Eligibility Criteria
•A graduating senior at any metropolitan Atlanta high school
•Cumulative high school grade point average of 3.0 or higher
•Combined SAT score of 1000 or higher (critical reading and math only) or ACT composite of 22 or higher
•Acceptance to a college or university to pursue an undergraduate degree
Award Amount
Up to $1,000 annually
Scholarships Available
Two awards annually
Deadline
February 14, 2020 more...

Yellow Ribbon Retention Scholarship
The Yellow Ribbon Retention Scholarship will provide scholarships to students who demonstrate need and have been identified by the Office of Financial Aid as being at significant risk of not being able to continue their education at Clayton State University due to financial challenges with preference given to Veterans. The scholarship can also be awarded to MOWR students. more...
